name: priorly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
before a particular time or event, or before the present: Seedlings that had been priorly grown in the open for three months were included in the experiment. The exact content of the sound files has been priorly decided by the performer, in the studio.
More examplesFewer examplesThe new state failed to reflect the power balance that had existed priorly. The patient tested negative for the disease, probably because of antibiotics received priorly at the clinic. The testimony of the witness had been priorly recorded in writing.
